property.name: pulsar.config.id
property.description: The name of the current task

property.name: pulsar.master.host
property.description: A internet ip, hostname, or domain. All fetch servers register itself using a internet domain so satellites can do tasks from the internet.

property.name: pulsar.master.hostname
property.description: A Intranet access point. All slave pulsar update proxy server list and other resource if any from the master pulsar server. It must be the host name which is in /etc/hostname since we need to check whether it's the host itself.

property.name: fetch.store.content
property.description: Page content is not stored because all pages are indexed.

property.name: fetcher.threads.per.queue
property.description: This number is the maximum number of threads that should be allowed to access a queue at one time. Setting it to a value > 1 will cause the Crawl-Delay value from robots.txt to be ignored and the value of fetch.queue.min.delay to be used as a delay between successive requests to the same server instead of fetch.queue.delay.

property.name: fetcher.net.bandwidth.m
property.description: Hardware bandwidth in Mbytes, if exceed the limit, slows down the task scheduling.

property.name: fetcher.task.timeout
property.description: fetch thread will exit if no any fetch item for fetcher.task.timeout minutes

property.name: score.sort.web.graph.score.divisor
property.description: Classify web graph score into levels
